summaryText: What a powerful message about God's presence in our valleys! Pastor Travis Hearn delivers an incredibly encouraging sermon about navigating life's challenging seasons. Sometimes we think God only shows up on the mountaintops, but PT reminds us that He is just as present - and powerful - in our deepest valleys. Drawing from Psalm 23, he reveals four incredible insights about God's work during our most difficult times: God is growing us, defending us, anointing us, and setting us up for blessing. Can you imagine that the very challenges trying to break you are actually God's method of preparing you for something amazing? PT shares that our greatest ministries are often birthed from our greatest miseries. The sermon powerfully reminds us that no matter what valley you're walking through right now, God is not just with you, but He is actively working on your behalf. What the enemy means for destruction, God will use for your development and destiny!
mainPoints: God is present and purposeful in our life's valleys
Valleys are opportunities for spiritual growth and transformation
Trust God's process even when you can't see the outcome

versesMentioned.text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters. He restores my soul. He leads me in paths of righteousness for his name's sake. Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me. You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies; you anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows. Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I shall dwell in the house of the Lord forever.

Beloved, do not be surprised at the fiery trial when it comes upon you to test you, as though something strange were happening to you. But rejoice insofar as you are sharing Christ's sufferings, that you may also be glad when his glory is revealed.

And a man of God came near and said to the king of Israel, 'Thus says the Lord, 'Because the Syrians have said, 'The Lord is a god of the hills but he is not a god of the valleys,' therefore I will give all this great multitude into your hand, and you shall know that I am the Lord.'

The Spirit of the Lord God is upon me, because the Lord has anointed me to bring good news to the poor; he has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to those who are bound.
But he was pierced for our transgressions; he was crushed for our iniquities; upon him was the chastisement that brought us peace, and with his wounds we are healed.

Count it all joy, my brothers, when you meet trials of various kinds, for you know that the testing of your faith produces steadfastness. And let steadfastness have its full effect, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing.
And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God's presence in our most difficult moments
Monday.action: Identify a current valley in your life. Write down three specific ways you've seen God's hand, even subtly, during this challenging season.
Monday.prayer: Lord, open my eyes to Your presence. Help me trust that You are working, even when I cannot see or understand Your plan. Give me faith to believe in Your goodness. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Isaiah 43:2: 'When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and through the rivers, they shall not overwhelm you; when you walk through fire you shall not be burned, and the flame shall not consume you.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding that valleys are opportunities for growth
Tuesday.action: Reflect on a past difficult season. Journal how that experience made you stronger and more dependent on God.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for never leaving me alone in my struggles. Help me view my challenges as opportunities for spiritual development. Give me wisdom to learn and grow. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all things through him who strengthens me.'
Wednesday.focus: Finding strength in God during challenging times
Wednesday.action: Make a list of your current challenges. Beside each one, write a prayer of surrender and trust in God's plan.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I surrender my fears and challenges to You. Fill me with Your supernatural strength and peace. Help me trust Your process, even when I can't see the full picture. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.'
Thursday.action: Identify an area where you're struggling to trust God's plan. Spend time in prayer, intentionally releasing control.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me trust Your plans are better than my own. Give me patience and peace to wait on Your timing. Strengthen my faith in Your goodness. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 4:17: 'For this light momentary affliction is preparing for us an eternal weight of glory beyond all comparison.'
Friday.action: Practice gratitude. Write down three blessings that have emerged from challenging seasons in your past.
Friday.prayer: Heavenly Father, help me see my challenges through Your eternal perspective. Transform my view of difficulties into opportunities for growth and glory. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: James 1:12: 'Blessed is the man who remains steadfast under trial, for when he has stood the test he will receive the crown of life, which God has promised to those who love him.'
Saturday.action: Create a personal 'faith milestone' journal. Record moments where God has been faithful during past challenges.
Saturday.prayer: God, build my faith. Help me remember Your faithfulness and develop spiritual resilience. Use my trials to draw me closer to You. Amen.
